meanings.definition: A person or thing that exhausts or drains something.
meanings.sent1: The exhausters in the factory work tirelessly to remove all the waste materials.
meanings.sent2: The exhausters in the gym help keep the air fresh and clean for everyone working out.
meanings.sent3: The exhausters at the party were the energetic dancers who never seemed to tire.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an exhauster, draining all the tension from the room.
meanings.sent5: The exhausters in the vacuum cleaner sucked up all the dirt and dust with ease.

meanings.definition: A device used to remove air or gas from a closed space.
meanings.sent1: The exhausters in the kitchen quickly clear out any smoke from cooking.
meanings.sent2: The exhausters in the car help maintain a comfortable temperature during long drives.
meanings.sent3: The exhausters in the balloon made sure it didn't pop from too much air.
meanings.sent4: The exhausters in the submarine kept the crew safe by regulating the air pressure.
meanings.sent5: The exhausters in the air purifier ensure that the room always has fresh air.

meanings.definition: A component in a system that removes waste or unwanted substances.
meanings.sent1: The exhausters in the water filtration system help clean out impurities.
meanings.sent2: The exhausters in the engine ensure that harmful emissions are reduced.
meanings.sent3: The exhausters in the body's immune system fight off infections and keep us healthy.
meanings.sent4: The exhausters in the recycling plant separate recyclable materials from the waste.
meanings.sent5: The exhausters in the exhaust system of a car help reduce pollution levels.
